text: When you die, you appear in a cinema with a number of other people who look like you. You find out that they are your previous reincarnations, and soon you all begin watching your next life on the big screen.

When you die, you appear in a cinema with a number of other people who look like you. You are shocked and stricken with anxiety, as you are placed in an unfamiliar place all of the sudden. You deny the fact that you have died, and believe all that is happening is a dream. Turning to the person next to you, you ask them what is going on.  You find out that they are your previous reincarnations, and soon you all begin watching your next life on the big screen.

When you die, you appear in a cinema with a number of other people who look like you. You are shocked and stricken with anxiety, as you are placed in an unfamiliar place all of the sudden. You deny the fact that you have died, and believe all that is happening is a dream. Turning to the person next to you, you ask them what is going on.  You find out that they are your previous reincarnations, and soon you all begin watching your next life on the big screen. You see yourself in a different world, with a different family, different friends, and a different life.

When you die, you appear in a cinema with a number of other people who look like you. You are shocked and stricken with anxiety, as you are placed in an unfamiliar place all of the sudden. You deny the fact that you have died, and believe all that is happening is a dream. Turning to the person next to you, you ask them what is going on. The person, who could easily be your doppleganger tells you to be quiet, less you incur the wrath of the movie attendants. They mention they are all reincarnations of the same person, including yourself. They have been watching the lives of each incarnation, and will continue to do so for who knows how long.  You are then are silenced, and are told the next reincarnation will begin their lives soon, and you along with your past reincarnations all begin watching your next life on the big screen.

You are then are silenced, and are told the next reincarnation will begin their lives soon, and you along with your past reincarnations all begin watching your next life on the big screen. 

You see the new incarnation born in a different country, and with a different family. It starts off innocently enough, with the birth of the new reincarnation in a different hospital than you were born. You see your new parents, who are quite different than your old parents. Nevertheless, you are happy to them be with the new incarnation, and to see how close they are to them as they grow up. You also feel slightly envious, given that you never knew your own parents, who died in a car accident when you were two years old. You then see that your new incarnation has siblings as well, an older brother who is a year older than them, and an older sister that is 5 years older than the incarnation. You ponder more about your own life. Did you have siblings, and if so were you seperated with the death of your parents? Your thoughts turn to your other reincarnations, were they also orphans with no siblings, or did they have families that took care of them since birth. Putting your thoughts aside, you continue watching as see your incarnation grow up throughout the years.

You see their relationship with friends, lovers, and others enter turmulent times, and see their own struggles with their mental health. You empthasize with them, hoping they get better and that they seek help.

You see them go through the similar struggles you went through as an adult, and you understand that other reincarnations in the room likely have similar thoughts as you as well. Your incarnation grows older, starts a family, and has kid. But to your shock, they end up dying at the age of 32, younger than you died. Soon, the screen grows dark, and you realize that you will soon watch the next life of the newest reincarnation.
